trans-unit.source: WP00 SonoUno: Sonification Software for astronomical data files presented in table format.
trans-unit.target: WP00 SonoUno: Sonification Software for astronomical data files presented in table format.

trans-unit.source: Contents for Executive Summary, section 1 and 1.1
trans-unit.target: Contents for Executive Summary, section 1 and 1.1

trans-unit.source: The other is the shortcut Shift+W.
trans-unit.target: The other is the shortcut Shift+W.

trans-unit.source: Both methods have the same results.
trans-unit.target: Both methods have the same results.

trans-unit.source: A way the user can store the sound from the data provided to sonoUno is the ‚ÄúSave Sound‚Äù feature (Image 13). T In order to save the sound, the user has to press the save sound item on the File menu
trans-unit.target: A way the user can store the sound from the data provided to sonoUno is the ‚ÄúSave Sound‚Äù feature (Image 13). T In order to save the sound, the user has to press the save sound item on the File menu

trans-unit.source: This document contains information which is proprietary to the REINFORCE Consortium. Neither this document nor the information contained herein shall be used, duplicated or communicated by any means to a third party, in whole or parts, except with the prior consent of the REINFORCE Consortium.

trans-unit.source: The software will process the sound corresponding to the actual data displayed in the plot but with some standard sound configuration and then store it in your computer on a .wav file (image 14).
trans-unit.target: The software will process the sound corresponding to the actual data displayed in the plot but with some standard sound configuration and then store it in your computer on a .wav file (image 14).

trans-unit.source: The process to save the sound depends on the data file and can take some minutes.
trans-unit.target: The process to save the sound depends on the data file and can take some minutes.

trans-unit.source: Before continuing with the save methods, remember that the software allows to do marks of interest on the data (Image 15), saving the coordinates inside an array, this topic is explained in the corresponding section. We mention it here because in the next lines the save marks method is described.
trans-unit.target: Before continuing with the save methods, remember that the software allows to do marks of interest on the data (Image 15), saving the coordinates inside an array, this topic is explained in the corresponding section. We mention it here because in the next lines the save marks method is described.

trans-unit.source: In order to save the values of the marks performed on the data array the user has to press the save markers item, placed on the File menu (Image 15).
trans-unit.target: In order to save the values of the marks performed on the data array the user has to press the save markers item, placed on the File menu (Image 15).

trans-unit.source: The save marks option shows a pop-up window of the file system (Image 16) that allows the user to select the directory and the name of the text file. After saving them, the marks are deleted from the sonoUno and the plot (Image 17).
trans-unit.target: The save marks option shows a pop-up window of the file system (Image 16) that allows the user to select the directory and the name of the text file. After saving them, the marks are deleted from the sonoUno and the plot (Image 17).

trans-unit.source: The save markers option shows a similar pop-up window to the ‚Äúsave sound‚Äù feature, and then downloads the .csv file. The format of the name is the plot‚Äôs title plus ‚Äú markers.csv‚Äù.
trans-unit.target: The save markers option shows a similar pop-up window to the ‚Äúsave sound‚Äù feature, and then downloads the .csv file. The format of the name is the plot‚Äôs title plus ‚Äú markers.csv‚Äù.

trans-unit.source: 3.1 MARK AND DELETE ALL MARKS BUTTON
trans-unit.target: 3.1 MARK AND DELETE ALL MARKS BUTTON

trans-unit.source: It's important to remember that the array of markers should have at least one marker in order for this to work properly.
trans-unit.target: It's important to remember that the array of markers should have at least one marker in order for this to work properly.

trans-unit.source: The resulting files in your downloads folders should look something like in Image 18. The original .csv file with the provided data, a .csv file with the markers and a .wav file with the sound.
trans-unit.target: The resulting files in your downloads folders should look something like in Image 18. The original .csv file with the provided data, a .csv file with the markers and a .wav file with the sound.

trans-unit.source: If the user opens the markers.csv file with a text editor the coordinates of that mark are going to be displayed with two columns separated by a comma corresponding to the x and y coordinates of that particular mark (Image 20).
trans-unit.target: If the user opens the markers.csv file with a text editor the coordinates of that mark are going to be displayed with two columns separated by a comma corresponding to the x and y coordinates of that particular mark (Image 20).

trans-unit.source: And opening the wav file is going to start playing it in the default media player of your operating system, in the image a screenshot of the mac music player.
trans-unit.target: And opening the wav file is going to start playing it in the default media player of your operating system, in the image a screenshot of the mac music player.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 01 THE IMAGE SHOWS FIREFOX BROWSER AND THE WEB LANDING PAGE OF SONOUNO
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 01 THE IMAGE SHOWS FIREFOX BROWSER AND THE WEB LANDING PAGE OF SONOUNO

trans-unit.source: Being web based, exiting sonoUno is as simple as closing your current tab hitting the ‚ÄúX‚Äù at the end of the tabs title. The default shortcut for most browsers is Ctrl+W or Cmd+W depending on your operating system, this may vary.
trans-unit.target: Being web based, exiting sonoUno is as simple as closing your current tab hitting the ‚ÄúX‚Äù at the end of the tabs title. The default shortcut for most browsers is Ctrl+W or Cmd+W depending on your operating system, this may vary.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 02 THE IMAGE SHOWS FIREFOX BROWSER AND THE QUICKSTART GUIDE OF SONOUNO
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 02 THE IMAGE SHOWS FIREFOX BROWSER AND THE QUICKSTART GUIDE OF SONOUNO

trans-unit.source: Important: Be sure to store every piece of data you want to save before closing the tab to avoid data loss.
trans-unit.target: Important: Be sure to store every piece of data you want to save before closing the tab to avoid data loss.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 03 SONOUNO HOME PAGE. PLOT AREA AND MENU.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 03 SONOUNO HOME PAGE. PLOT AREA AND MENU.

trans-unit.source: You can also quit sonoUno by closing your browser, just keep in mind that you are going to close every other tab opened at the time.
trans-unit.target: You can also quit sonoUno by closing your browser, just keep in mind that you are going to close every other tab opened at the time.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 04 SONOUNO HOME PAGE. PLOT AREA FUNCTIONALITIES AND ABSCISSA AND TEMPO SLIDERS. BELLOW, MATH FUNCTIONS BAR AND BELLOW THAT BAR, SOUND AND PLOT CONFIGURATION BUTTONS
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 04 SONOUNO HOME PAGE. PLOT AREA FUNCTIONALITIES AND ABSCISSA AND TEMPO SLIDERS. BELLOW, MATH FUNCTIONS BAR AND BELLOW THAT BAR, SOUND AND PLOT CONFIGURATION BUTTONS

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 05 SONOUNO HOME PAGE. SOUND FUNCTIONALITIES AND CONFIGURATIONS
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 05 SONOUNO HOME PAGE. SOUND FUNCTIONALITIES AND CONFIGURATIONS

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 06 SONOUNO HOME PAGE. PLOT FUNCTIONALITIES AND CONFIGURATIONS
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 06 SONOUNO HOME PAGE. PLOT FUNCTIONALITIES AND CONFIGURATIONS

trans-unit.source: The slider of abscissa position allows the user to shift the point of data being played (Image 21). The slider shows the posicion (with a number) and also is possible to move it wuth the keyboard arrows if the mouse is on this button .
trans-unit.target: The slider of abscissa position allows the user to shift the point of data being played (Image 21). The slider shows the posicion (with a number) and also is possible to move it wuth the keyboard arrows if the mouse is on this button .

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 08 SHOWS THE ITEMS ON THE MENU FILE AND THE FOCUS OF THE KEYBOARD IS ON THE OPEN ITEM.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 08 SHOWS THE ITEMS ON THE MENU FILE AND THE FOCUS OF THE KEYBOARD IS ON THE OPEN ITEM.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 09 POP-UP WINDOW OF THE FILE EXPLORER, SHOWN AFTER SELECTING THE ITEM.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 09 POP-UP WINDOW OF THE FILE EXPLORER, SHOWN AFTER SELECTING THE ITEM.

trans-unit.source: Image 21 Shows the slider, while being selected is possible to move it left and right with your keyboard arrows
trans-unit.target: Image 21 Shows the slider, while being selected is possible to move it left and right with your keyboard arrows

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 10 THE SONOUNO FRAMEWORK WITH THE GRAPH OF THE IMPORTED DATA, IN THIS CASE A GW GLITCH.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 10 THE SONOUNO FRAMEWORK WITH THE GRAPH OF THE IMPORTED DATA, IN THIS CASE A GW GLITCH.

trans-unit.source: Image 22 As you can see the percentage of the ‚ÄúAbscissa Position Slider‚Äù corresponds to the position of the black line on the plot.
trans-unit.target: Image 22 As you can see the percentage of the ‚ÄúAbscissa Position Slider‚Äù corresponds to the position of the black line on the plot.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 11 SHOWS THE ITEMS ON THE MENU FILE AND THE FOCUS OF THE KEYBOARD IS ON THE OPEN ITEM.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 11 SHOWS THE ITEMS ON THE MENU FILE AND THE FOCUS OF THE KEYBOARD IS ON THE OPEN ITEM.

trans-unit.source: The abscissa position can be modified before, during and after the reproduction of the data. If the reproduction is in progress, after change the reproduction continues from the new set value.
trans-unit.target: The abscissa position can be modified before, during and after the reproduction of the data. If the reproduction is in progress, after change the reproduction continues from the new set value.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 12 POP-UP WINDOW OF THE FILE EXPLORER, SHOWN AFTER SELECTING THE ITEM.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 12 POP-UP WINDOW OF THE FILE EXPLORER, SHOWN AFTER SELECTING THE ITEM.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 13 THE SONOUNO FRAMEWORK WITH THE GRAPH OF THE IMPORTED DATA FROM THE WAV FILE.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 13 THE SONOUNO FRAMEWORK WITH THE GRAPH OF THE IMPORTED DATA FROM THE WAV FILE.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 14 SHOWS THE ITEMS ON THE MENU FILE.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 14 SHOWS THE ITEMS ON THE MENU FILE.

trans-unit.source: This slider controls the duration of each tone. The range goes from 0% to 100%, being 100 the shortest and 0 the longest time.
trans-unit.target: This slider controls the duration of each tone. The range goes from 0% to 100%, being 100 the shortest and 0 the longest time.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 15 POP-UP WINDOW OF THE FILE EXPLORER, SHOWN AFTER SELECTING THE ITEM.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 15 POP-UP WINDOW OF THE FILE EXPLORER, SHOWN AFTER SELECTING THE ITEM.

trans-unit.source: It‚Äôs placed under the plot and to the right of the abscissa slider (Image 23). The operation is analogous to the abscissa position slider.
trans-unit.target: It‚Äôs placed under the plot and to the right of the abscissa slider (Image 23). The operation is analogous to the abscissa position slider.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 16 THE SONOUNO FRAMEWORK WITH THE GRAPH OF THE IMPORTED DATA FROM THE WAV FILE.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 16 THE SONOUNO FRAMEWORK WITH THE GRAPH OF THE IMPORTED DATA FROM THE WAV FILE.

trans-unit.source: Image 23 The tempo slider is on the bottom right of the image.
trans-unit.target: Image 23 The tempo slider is on the bottom right of the image.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 17 DISPLAYS THE SONOUNO INTERFACE WITH AN OPENED DATA FILE, IN THE PLOT THERE IS ONE VERTICAL BLACK LINE (POSITION OF THE PLAYING COORDINATE) AND SEVERAL BLUE CIRCLES MARKING POINTS OF INTEREST ON THE GRAPH.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 17 DISPLAYS THE SONOUNO INTERFACE WITH AN OPENED DATA FILE, IN THE PLOT THERE IS ONE VERTICAL BLACK LINE (POSITION OF THE PLAYING COORDINATE) AND SEVERAL BLUE CIRCLES MARKING POINTS OF INTEREST ON THE GRAPH.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 18 DISPLAYS THE SONOUNO INTERFACE WITH AN OPENED DATA FILE. AT THE TOP MENU, THE OUTPUT BUTTON DISPLAYS THE SAVE SOUND, SAVE MARKERS , SAVE PLOT POSSIBILITIES.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 18 DISPLAYS THE SONOUNO INTERFACE WITH AN OPENED DATA FILE. AT THE TOP MENU, THE OUTPUT BUTTON DISPLAYS THE SAVE SOUND, SAVE MARKERS , SAVE PLOT POSSIBILITIES.

trans-unit.source: It‚Äôs the first button under the graph (Image 24). When pressed, it changes its name to ‚ÄúPause‚Äù and starts the reproduction of the data, the vertical black line and the abscissa position slider start to go forward, indicating the coordinates of the data being played.
trans-unit.target: It‚Äôs the first button under the graph (Image 24). When pressed, it changes its name to ‚ÄúPause‚Äù and starts the reproduction of the data, the vertical black line and the abscissa position slider start to go forward, indicating the coordinates of the data being played.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 19 SHOWS THE FILE MENU OPENED IN THE NAVIGATION BAR AND THE SAVE SOUND OPTION SELECTED
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 19 SHOWS THE FILE MENU OPENED IN THE NAVIGATION BAR AND THE SAVE SOUND OPTION SELECTED

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 20 SHOWS THE POP UP PANEL THAT OPENS AFTER PRESSING SAVE SOUND FOR A MAC. IF NO POP-UP IS OPENED, YOU MAY HAVE CHECKED THE AUTO DOWNLOAD OPTION ON YOUR BROWSER AND YOUR FILE SHOULD BE IN YOUR DOWNLOADS FOLDER.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 20 SHOWS THE POP UP PANEL THAT OPENS AFTER PRESSING SAVE SOUND FOR A MAC. IF NO POP-UP IS OPENED, YOU MAY HAVE CHECKED THE AUTO DOWNLOAD OPTION ON YOUR BROWSER AND YOUR FILE SHOULD BE IN YOUR DOWNLOADS FOLDER.

trans-unit.source: Image 24 The play button is found on the bottom left of the image, under the graph, being the first button
trans-unit.target: Image 24 The play button is found on the bottom left of the image, under the graph, being the first button

trans-unit.source: Another way to start the reproduction is with the shortcut key ‚ÄùShift+P‚Äù. This way of interacting differs from the previous two, because when pressed produces the effect directly, without modifying the keyboard focus.
trans-unit.target: Another way to start the reproduction is with the shortcut key ‚ÄùShift+P‚Äù. This way of interacting differs from the previous two, because when pressed produces the effect directly, without modifying the keyboard focus.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 21 SHOWS THE SAVE MARKERS OPTION FOCUSED ON THE FILE MENU.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 21 SHOWS THE SAVE MARKERS OPTION FOCUSED ON THE FILE MENU.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 22 POP-UP WINDOW OF THE COMPUTER FILE SYSTEM SAVING THE MARKERS CSV FILE (MAC OS)
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 22 POP-UP WINDOW OF THE COMPUTER FILE SYSTEM SAVING THE MARKERS CSV FILE (MAC OS)

trans-unit.source: To pause the reproduction of the data you have to press the same button or the same shortcut key, this action maintains the vertical red line position to be able to resume it later with the play button.
trans-unit.target: To pause the reproduction of the data you have to press the same button or the same shortcut key, this action maintains the vertical red line position to be able to resume it later with the play button.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 23 THE INTERFACE IS SHOWN BEFORE AND AFTER CLICKING THE ‚ÄúSAVE MARKERS‚Äù BUTTON. THE PLAY BAR IS KEPT IN PLACE BUT MARKERS ARE ERASED AFTER SAVING THEM TO A CSV FILE (UBUNTU OS)
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 23 THE INTERFACE IS SHOWN BEFORE AND AFTER CLICKING THE ‚ÄúSAVE MARKERS‚Äù BUTTON. THE PLAY BAR IS KEPT IN PLACE BUT MARKERS ARE ERASED AFTER SAVING THEM TO A CSV FILE (UBUNTU OS)

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 24 DATA SAVED FROM SONOUNO WEB
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 24 DATA SAVED FROM SONOUNO WEB

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 25 A VIEW OF THE FILE EXPLORER AND BOTH, MARKERS AND AUDIO FILES OPENED.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 25 A VIEW OF THE FILE EXPLORER AND BOTH, MARKERS AND AUDIO FILES OPENED.

trans-unit.source: Its function is to stop the reproduction and restart the process, which means that it sets the abscissa position to zero and deletes the vertical red line from the plot (Image 25). Another way to stop the reproduction is with the shortcut key ‚ÄòShift+S‚Äô.
trans-unit.target: Its function is to stop the reproduction and restart the process, which means that it sets the abscissa position to zero and deletes the vertical red line from the plot (Image 25). Another way to stop the reproduction is with the shortcut key ‚ÄòShift+S‚Äô.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 26 A VIEW OF THE SAVED ‚ÄúMARKERS.CSV‚Äù FILE
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 26 A VIEW OF THE SAVED ‚ÄúMARKERS.CSV‚Äù FILE

trans-unit.source: Image 25 The stop button is placed next to the Play button.
trans-unit.target: Image 25 The stop button is placed next to the Play button.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 27 SHOWS THE SLIDER, WHILE BEING SELECTED IS POSSIBLE TO MOVE IT LEFT AND RIGHT WITH YOUR KEYBOARD ARROWS
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 27 SHOWS THE SLIDER, WHILE BEING SELECTED IS POSSIBLE TO MOVE IT LEFT AND RIGHT WITH YOUR KEYBOARD ARROWS

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 28 AS YOU CAN SEE THE PERCENTAGE OF THE ‚ÄúABSCISSA POSITION SLIDER‚Äù CORRESPONDS TO THE POSITION OF THE BLACK LINE ON THE PLOT.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 28 AS YOU CAN SEE THE PERCENTAGE OF THE ‚ÄúABSCISSA POSITION SLIDER‚Äù CORRESPONDS TO THE POSITION OF THE BLACK LINE ON THE PLOT.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 29 THE TEMPO SLIDER IS ON THE BOTTOM RIGHT OF THE IMAGE.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 29 THE TEMPO SLIDER IS ON THE BOTTOM RIGHT OF THE IMAGE.

trans-unit.source: This button allows the user to mark a specific point from the data. When the button is pressed sonoUno saves the current position on a vector and displays it on the graph with a symbol. (Image 26)
trans-unit.target: This button allows the user to mark a specific point from the data. When the button is pressed sonoUno saves the current position on a vector and displays it on the graph with a symbol. (Image 26)

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 30 THE PLAY BUTTON IS FOUND ON THE BOTTOM LEFT OF THE IMAGE, UNDER THE GRAPH, BEING THE FIRST BUTTON
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 30 THE PLAY BUTTON IS FOUND ON THE BOTTOM LEFT OF THE IMAGE, UNDER THE GRAPH, BEING THE FIRST BUTTON

trans-unit.source: Image 26 The mark point button is found under the graph, next to the stop button.
trans-unit.target: Image 26 The mark point button is found under the graph, next to the stop button.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 31 THE STOP BUTTON IS PLACED NEXT TO THE PLAY BUTTON.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 31 THE STOP BUTTON IS PLACED NEXT TO THE PLAY BUTTON.

trans-unit.source: In parallel, the user can mark a point on the graph with the shortcut key ‚ÄòShift+M‚Äô. The shortcut has the same effect as pressing the button but without modifying the keyboard focus.
trans-unit.target: In parallel, the user can mark a point on the graph with the shortcut key ‚ÄòShift+M‚Äô. The shortcut has the same effect as pressing the button but without modifying the keyboard focus.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 32 THE MARK POINT BUTTON IS FOUND UNDER THE GRAPH, NEXT TO THE STOP BUTTON.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 32 THE MARK POINT BUTTON IS FOUND UNDER THE GRAPH, NEXT TO THE STOP BUTTON.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 33 THE DELETE LAST MARK BUTTON IS FOUND ON THE BOTTOM RIGHT OF THE GRAPH SECTION. IT‚ÄôS THE FOURTH BUTTON FROM LEFT TO RIGHT.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 33 THE DELETE LAST MARK BUTTON IS FOUND ON THE BOTTOM RIGHT OF THE GRAPH SECTION. IT‚ÄôS THE FOURTH BUTTON FROM LEFT TO RIGHT.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 34 BELOW ABSCISSA, TEMPO AND MATH SLIDERS ARE USER MODIFIABLE CONFIGURATIONS FOR SOUND AND PLOT.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 34 BELOW ABSCISSA, TEMPO AND MATH SLIDERS ARE USER MODIFIABLE CONFIGURATIONS FOR SOUND AND PLOT.

trans-unit.source: This functionality allows the user to erase the last mark made with the mark point element. It‚Äôs useful when the user has made a mark without intention or the place is incorrect. The button is placed beneath the graph, it‚Äôs the fourth button, next to the mark point button (Image 27).
trans-unit.target: This functionality allows the user to erase the last mark made with the mark point element. It‚Äôs useful when the user has made a mark without intention or the place is incorrect. The button is placed beneath the graph, it‚Äôs the fourth button, next to the mark point button (Image 27).

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 35 A SLIDER ALLOWS TO MODIFY THE FREQUENCY
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 35 A SLIDER ALLOWS TO MODIFY THE FREQUENCY

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 36 A SLIDER ALLOWS TO MODIFY THE VOLUME OF THE SOUND AND THE SOUND TYPE
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 36 A SLIDER ALLOWS TO MODIFY THE VOLUME OF THE SOUND AND THE SOUND TYPE

trans-unit.source: Another way to erase the last mark point is with the shortcut key ‚ÄòShift+D‚Äô.
trans-unit.target: Another way to erase the last mark point is with the shortcut key ‚ÄòShift+D‚Äô.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 38 SHOWS THE BASIC PLOT CONFIGURATION SECTION
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 38 SHOWS THE BASIC PLOT CONFIGURATION SECTION

trans-unit.source: SonoUno web allows the user to adjust some sound and plot settings,these options are at the bottom of the page (Image 28).
trans-unit.target: SonoUno web allows the user to adjust some sound and plot settings,these options are at the bottom of the page (Image 28).

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 39 THE STYLE SECTION OF THE PLOT CONFIGURATION COUNTS WITH THREE COMBO BOXES THAT ALLOWS USERS TO SELECT FROM A LIST OF DIFFERENT OPTIONS TO MODIFY THE WAY THE GRAPH LOOKS.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 39 THE STYLE SECTION OF THE PLOT CONFIGURATION COUNTS WITH THREE COMBO BOXES THAT ALLOWS USERS TO SELECT FROM A LIST OF DIFFERENT OPTIONS TO MODIFY THE WAY THE GRAPH LOOKS.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 40 THE LINE STYLE ELEMENT IS A DROP-DOWN LIST WITH FOUR DIFFERENT STYLES.IN THE IMAGE THE DASH-DOT LINE OPTION IS SELECTED.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 40 THE LINE STYLE ELEMENT IS A DROP-DOWN LIST WITH FOUR DIFFERENT STYLES.IN THE IMAGE THE DASH-DOT LINE OPTION IS SELECTED.

trans-unit.source: Centre National De La Recherche Scientifique
trans-unit.target: Centre National De La Recherche Scientifique

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 41 THE MARKER STYLE ELEMENT IS A DROP-DOWN LIST, WHERE THERE ARE DIFFERENT OPTIONS. IN THE IMAGE THE DIAMOND MARKER STYLE IS SELECTED.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 41 THE MARKER STYLE ELEMENT IS A DROP-DOWN LIST, WHERE THERE ARE DIFFERENT OPTIONS. IN THE IMAGE THE DIAMOND MARKER STYLE IS SELECTED.

trans-unit.source: The location of the sound configurations is on the bottom left of the page
trans-unit.target: The location of the sound configurations is on the bottom left of the page

trans-unit.source: The plot configurations are located on the bottom right of the page. This tool is divided in.
trans-unit.target: The plot configurations are located on the bottom right of the page. This tool is divided in.

trans-unit.source: The sound configuration can be divided into 3 distincts parts.
trans-unit.target: The sound configuration can be divided into 3 distincts parts.

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 42 THE COLOR STYLE ELEMENT IS A DROP-DOWN LIST, WHERE THERE ARE SEVEN OPTIONS. IN THE IMAGE THE ORANGE COLOR STYLE IS SELECTED. IN ADDITION, THE DOTTED LINE STYLE AND CIRCLE MARKER HAVE BEEN CHOSEN.
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 42 THE COLOR STYLE ELEMENT IS A DROP-DOWN LIST, WHERE THERE ARE SEVEN OPTIONS. IN THE IMAGE THE ORANGE COLOR STYLE IS SELECTED. IN ADDITION, THE DOTTED LINE STYLE AND CIRCLE MARKER HAVE BEEN CHOSEN.

trans-unit.source: frequency range and sound types selection (Image 29),
trans-unit.target: frequency range and sound types selection (Image 29),

trans-unit.source: volume and buttons to set logarithmic scale and continuous sound (Image 30),
trans-unit.target: volume and buttons to set logarithmic scale and continuous sound (Image 30),

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 44 NEW COLOR AND PLOT AND AXES NAMES
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 44 NEW COLOR AND PLOT AND AXES NAMES

trans-unit.source: advanced functions configuration, which includes the logarithmic scale, discrete or continuous sound and envelop (Image 31)
trans-unit.target: advanced functions configuration, which includes the logarithmic scale, discrete or continuous sound and envelop (Image 31)

trans-unit.source: IMAGE 46 MODAL WINDOW WITH THE PEAK FINDER SETTINGS
trans-unit.target: IMAGE 46 MODAL WINDOW WITH THE PEAK FINDER SETTINGS

trans-unit.source: A checkbox allows for the selection of frequency mapping and the two sliders beneath it modify the minimum and maximum frequency used in the variable mapping.
trans-unit.target: A checkbox allows for the selection of frequency mapping and the two sliders beneath it modify the minimum and maximum frequency used in the variable mapping.

trans-unit.source: The next combo box, with a list, allows the user to choose between some sound types to use. These sounds are not intended to sound like real instruments, but rather just loosely recall those instrument‚Äôs sounds in order to present the user with some distinguishable options.
trans-unit.target: The next combo box, with a list, allows the user to choose between some sound types to use. These sounds are not intended to sound like real instruments, but rather just loosely recall those instrument‚Äôs sounds in order to present the user with some distinguishable options.

trans-unit.source: The Advanced Sound Configurations includes the configuration of envelope filters (Image 31). A checkbox is used to enable and disable the filter. After checking it you can use the attack, decay, sustain and release sliders to modify the resulting sound.
trans-unit.target: The Advanced Sound Configurations includes the configuration of envelope filters (Image 31). A checkbox is used to enable and disable the filter. After checking it you can use the attack, decay, sustain and release sliders to modify the resulting sound.

trans-unit.source: NOTE: All the sliders inside the mapping configuration must be enabled and disabled with check boxes, this is to ensure a better navigation with the screen reader and a lower memory overload.
trans-unit.target: NOTE: All the sliders inside the mapping configuration must be enabled and disabled with check boxes, this is to ensure a better navigation with the screen reader and a lower memory overload.

trans-unit.source: Institute of Accelerating Systems and Applications
trans-unit.target: Institute of Accelerating Systems and Applications

trans-unit.source: basic: title of the plot, name of the axes (Image 32),
trans-unit.target: basic: title of the plot, name of the axes (Image 32),

trans-unit.source: advanced configurations: line, marker and color styles (Image 33):
trans-unit.target: advanced configurations: line, marker and color styles (Image 33):

trans-unit.source: If you wish, you can also change the titles of the different parts of the graph. These are simple text boxes with the name that is actually displayed and you can choose to edit the name that is displayed or erase and type a new one. (No need to type enter after modifying it.)
trans-unit.target: If you wish, you can also change the titles of the different parts of the graph. These are simple text boxes with the name that is actually displayed and you can choose to edit the name that is displayed or erase and type a new one. (No need to type enter after modifying it.)

trans-unit.source: The last version of sonoUno web includes the possibility to apply predefined mathematical functions, such as logarithm, square and smooth (Image 39), to the data. It is the first approach to the next step, which will allow you to use any function
trans-unit.target: The last version of sonoUno web includes the possibility to apply predefined mathematical functions, such as logarithm, square and smooth (Image 39), to the data. It is the first approach to the next step, which will allow you to use any function

trans-unit.source: On the plot configuration panel, after the line style label, is placed the drop-down list box with five options of style, which are: solid line, dashed line, dash-dot line and dotted line. In the example of the Image 34 the dash-dot line style is shown, with blue color and without markers.
trans-unit.target: On the plot configuration panel, after the line style label, is placed the drop-down list box with five options of style, which are: solid line, dashed line, dash-dot line and dotted line. In the example of the Image 34 the dash-dot line style is shown, with blue color and without markers.

trans-unit.source: The settings window counts with a sensitivity slider that you can set to the value that best works for the current data. A button for cleaning the peaks and a button to add them like markers on the graph. Once you have marked them on the graph you can previsualize the effects of the changes on the slider.
trans-unit.target: The settings window counts with a sensitivity slider that you can set to the value that best works for the current data. A button for cleaning the peaks and a button to add them like markers on the graph. Once you have marked them on the graph you can previsualize the effects of the changes on the slider.

trans-unit.source: REsearch Infrastructure FOR Citizens in Europe
trans-unit.target: REsearch Infrastructure FOR Citizens in Europe

trans-unit.source: The marker style option works analogously to the ‚Äúline style‚Äù. It‚Äôs found just below the line style and offers some marker options: X, Circle, Star and diamond.In the Image 35 is used the Diamond down marker, with the dotted line style.
trans-unit.target: The marker style option works analogously to the ‚Äúline style‚Äù. It‚Äôs found just below the line style and offers some marker options: X, Circle, Star and diamond.In the Image 35 is used the Diamond down marker, with the dotted line style.

trans-unit.source: Next to the color style label, is placed the drop-down list with five colors: blue, orange, red, green and yellow.
trans-unit.target: Next to the color style label, is placed the drop-down list with five colors: blue, orange, red, green and yellow.

trans-unit.source: To modify the title just edit the text inside the text box next to the label of the title you want to edit (Image 37). The changes apply immediately after every keystroke and there's no need to type ‚Äúenter‚Äù after editing it (Image 38)
trans-unit.target: To modify the title just edit the text inside the text box next to the label of the title you want to edit (Image 37). The changes apply immediately after every keystroke and there's no need to type ‚Äúenter‚Äù after editing it (Image 38)

trans-unit.source: This function allows you to update every value in the data set with its square and update the graph.
trans-unit.target: This function allows you to update every value in the data set with its square and update the graph.

trans-unit.source: SonoUno is a sonification software for astronomical data presented on a table (txt or csv files). The software is being developed based on the study of other software (Sonification Sandbox, MathTrax and xSonify) and standards of accessibility like the ISO 9241-171:2008 (Guidance on software accessibility) and the Web Accessibility Initiative ‚Äì Accessible Rich Internet Applications (WAI-ARIA) guidelines. In order to develop the first approach of a graphical user interface, we perform a theoretical framework based on bibliography of user cases, focused on blind and visually impa people.
trans-unit.target: SonoUno is a sonification software for astronomical data presented on a table (txt or csv files). The software is being developed based on the study of other software (Sonification Sandbox, MathTrax and xSonify) and standards of accessibility like the ISO 9241-171:2008 (Guidance on software accessibility) and the Web Accessibility Initiative ‚Äì Accessible Rich Internet Applications (WAI-ARIA) guidelines. In order to develop the first approach of a graphical user interface, we perform a theoretical framework based on bibliography of user cases, focused on blind and visually impa people.

trans-unit.source: This function allows you to use a moving average data smoothing with the gate value indicating the average of how many values are used. By this you mitigate the impacts of short fluctuations.
trans-unit.target: This function allows you to use a moving average data smoothing with the gate value indicating the average of how many values are used. By this you mitigate the impacts of short fluctuations.

trans-unit.source: The development framework is Angular which promotes modularity, in order to do collaborative work. Being this version of SonoUno web based, is accessible from nearly any platform; the development team worked with this aim in mind. The main goal of SonoUno is to allow the user to open data files (txt or csv extension), show the plot and sonify the data. At the moment, the sonification is performed by variation of pitch and the sonification settings allow to change the volume and the timbre.
trans-unit.target: The development framework is Angular which promotes modularity, in order to do collaborative work. Being this version of SonoUno web based, is accessible from nearly any platform; the development team worked with this aim in mind. The main goal of SonoUno is to allow the user to open data files (txt or csv extension), show the plot and sonify the data. At the moment, the sonification is performed by variation of pitch and the sonification settings allow to change the volume and the timbre.

trans-unit.source: This function allows you to mark the peaks in the graph. For the intents of this function a peak is defined by the value that is bigger than the previous and next values and that also checks with the condition of being above the average of the graph plus a value calculated by the spread between the highest and lowest value multiplied by the sensitivity percentage
trans-unit.target: This function allows you to mark the peaks in the graph. For the intents of this function a peak is defined by the value that is bigger than the previous and next values and that also checks with the condition of being above the average of the graph plus a value calculated by the spread between the highest and lowest value multiplied by the sensitivity percentage

trans-unit.source: Additionally, SonoUno allows users to select a specific range of data on the ‚Äòx‚Äô axis, mark and save points of interest in the data, apply predefined mathematical functions (for example, logarithm and square) and manipulate the data arrays with an Octave interface. In the settings section, the user can configure the plot and some features of the sound.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, SonoUno allows users to select a specific range of data on the ‚Äòx‚Äô axis, mark and save points of interest in the data, apply predefined mathematical functions (for example, logarithm and square) and manipulate the data arrays with an Octave interface. In the settings section, the user can configure the plot and some features of the sound.

trans-unit.source: For closing the modal window you can click the "Close" button on the bottom left, the X besides the title or you can press the Escape key on your keyboard
trans-unit.target: For closing the modal window you can click the "Close" button on the bottom left, the X besides the title or you can press the Escape key on your keyboard

trans-unit.source: Finally, the software allows the user to save the plot, a text file with the points marked on the data and a csv file with the plotted data.
trans-unit.target: Finally, the software allows the user to save the plot, a text file with the points marked on the data and a csv file with the plotted data.

trans-unit.source: This function allows you to apply the common logarithmic to every value on the data set and updates the graph accordingly.
trans-unit.target: This function allows you to apply the common logarithmic to every value on the data set and updates the graph accordingly.

trans-unit.source: Being a web based application accessing to sonoUno it‚Äôs as easy as to type the url on your preferred browser:
trans-unit.target: Being a web based application accessing to sonoUno it‚Äôs as easy as to type the url on your preferred browser:

trans-unit.source: This link opens the landing page for the web version of sonoUno
trans-unit.target: This link opens the landing page for the web version of sonoUno

trans-unit.source: ¬†Angular‚Äôs support extends to the latest Edge, Firefox, Chrome and Safari versions, so it‚Äôs advised to update your browser. (Image 1). If after entering the url you don‚Äôt get the sonoUno‚Äôs homepage first check:
trans-unit.target: ¬†Angular‚Äôs support extends to the latest Edge, Firefox, Chrome and Safari versions, so it‚Äôs advised to update your browser. (Image 1). If after entering the url you don‚Äôt get the sonoUno‚Äôs homepage first check:

trans-unit.source: Check that you have typed the correct url.
trans-unit.target: Check that you have typed the correct url.

trans-unit.source: Check your network connection and access to the internet.
trans-unit.target: Check your network connection and access to the internet.

trans-unit.source: If after that you still can‚Äôt establish a connection send a message to the development team via e-mail:
trans-unit.target: If after that you still can‚Äôt establish a connection send a message to the development team via e-mail:

trans-unit.source: At the landing page it is possible to select between HOME and QUICK START and also decide if not to show this page again.
trans-unit.target: At the landing page it is possible to select between HOME and QUICK START and also decide if not to show this page again.

trans-unit.source: The recommendation is for the new users to go first to the QUICK START (Figure 2), where a short explanation of each section of the web interface (on the screen) and functionalities settings by default are detailed.
trans-unit.target: The recommendation is for the new users to go first to the QUICK START (Figure 2), where a short explanation of each section of the web interface (on the screen) and functionalities settings by default are detailed.

trans-unit.source: The home page of sonoUno greets you with four distinct sections:
trans-unit.target: The home page of sonoUno greets you with four distinct sections:

trans-unit.source: The navigation bar with the access to the File functionalities; Input/Output functions, Sample data and the access to the Help and the Quickstart guides. This design was based on a user case study (Image 3)
trans-unit.target: The navigation bar with the access to the File functionalities; Input/Output functions, Sample data and the access to the Help and the Quickstart guides. This design was based on a user case study (Image 3)

trans-unit.source: The graph has four buttons to control ‚ÄúPlay/Pause‚Äù, ‚ÄúStop‚Äù, ‚ÄúMark Point‚Äù and ‚ÄúDelete Mark‚Äù and two sliders to control the abscissa position and the tempo (Image 4).
trans-unit.target: The graph has four buttons to control ‚ÄúPlay/Pause‚Äù, ‚ÄúStop‚Äù, ‚ÄúMark Point‚Äù and ‚ÄúDelete Mark‚Äù and two sliders to control the abscissa position and the tempo (Image 4).

trans-unit.source: Below the sliders, a MathFunctions bar permits selecting between simple mathematical functions to apply to the data (Image 4)
trans-unit.target: Below the sliders, a MathFunctions bar permits selecting between simple mathematical functions to apply to the data (Image 4)

trans-unit.source: The sound configuration section has the tools to modify the way audio is processed, if you press on this button you will see all the Sound configuration options (Image 5).
trans-unit.target: The sound configuration section has the tools to modify the way audio is processed, if you press on this button you will see all the Sound configuration options (Image 5).

trans-unit.source: The plot configuration section allows you to modify the way the data is displayed in the graph, if you press on this button you will see all the Plot configuration options (Image 6).
trans-unit.target: The plot configuration section allows you to modify the way the data is displayed in the graph, if you press on this button you will see all the Plot configuration options (Image 6).

trans-unit.source: Every section will be explained in detail in further chapters of this help guide.
trans-unit.target: Every section will be explained in detail in further chapters of this help guide.

trans-unit.source: You can start testing the SonoUno functionalities with the sample data that's provided under the dropdown menu ‚ÄúSample Data‚Äù. Just select any of the options under this menu to get the data (Image 7) automatically loaded on your graph area and the audio be ready to play.
trans-unit.target: You can start testing the SonoUno functionalities with the sample data that's provided under the dropdown menu ‚ÄúSample Data‚Äù. Just select any of the options under this menu to get the data (Image 7) automatically loaded on your graph area and the audio be ready to play.

trans-unit.source: In order to listen to the graph just press the button ‚ÄúPlay‚Äù under the graph. You should see an orange bar moving from left to right indicating the progress on the data being played and hear the pitch variations matching the data.
trans-unit.target: In order to listen to the graph just press the button ‚ÄúPlay‚Äù under the graph. You should see an orange bar moving from left to right indicating the progress on the data being played and hear the pitch variations matching the data.

trans-unit.source: If you can see the black bar moving but still no sound comes out from your headphones or speakers:
trans-unit.target: If you can see the black bar moving but still no sound comes out from your headphones or speakers:

trans-unit.source: Check your speakers or headphones connection to your PC.
trans-unit.target: Check your speakers or headphones connection to your PC.

trans-unit.source: Check your sound configuration: volume level and mute.
trans-unit.target: Check your sound configuration: volume level and mute.

trans-unit.source: Check if your browser has blocked the sound reproduction and that the tab is not muted.
trans-unit.target: Check if your browser has blocked the sound reproduction and that the tab is not muted.

trans-unit.source: If the problems continue or you have another problem, please inform this to the developer team.
trans-unit.target: If the problems continue or you have another problem, please inform this to the developer team.

trans-unit.source: Some widgets, like warnings or confirmation buttons may be in your browser configured language. Otherwise, the software language is always English. In the future the team is looking forward to unifying the languages.
trans-unit.target: Some widgets, like warnings or confirmation buttons may be in your browser configured language. Otherwise, the software language is always English. In the future the team is looking forward to unifying the languages.

trans-unit.source: In the files to import the first column must have continuous values, it is used as a coordinate dependent axis.
trans-unit.target: In the files to import the first column must have continuous values, it is used as a coordinate dependent axis.

trans-unit.source: All screenshots and images shown are for illustration purposes only, the real image can change a little depending on the web browser.
trans-unit.target: All screenshots and images shown are for illustration purposes only, the real image can change a little depending on the web browser.

trans-unit.source: You can open files for three different reasons, you can open a csv with data to be displayed and played by sonouno, you could add a wav file to get the data from its envelope or you could add markers that you have previously saved for that data set.
trans-unit.target: You can open files for three different reasons, you can open a csv with data to be displayed and played by sonouno, you could add a wav file to get the data from its envelope or you could add markers that you have previously saved for that data set.

trans-unit.source: To open a .csv or .txt file with a new data set, you can use the option "Data CSV‚Äù under the Input dropdown menu (Image 8). This action will open a pop-up window with your operating system‚Äôs file explorer (Image 9), where you can search and open any data file.
trans-unit.target: To open a .csv or .txt file with a new data set, you can use the option "Data CSV‚Äù under the Input dropdown menu (Image 8). This action will open a pop-up window with your operating system‚Äôs file explorer (Image 9), where you can search and open any data file.

trans-unit.source: When you have the data file selected, press the button Open or the Enter key. The sonoUno will generate the graph (Image 10) and update the abscissa‚Äôs slide bar. Everything is ready, pressing the ‚ÄúPlay‚Äù button should start the reproduction.
trans-unit.target: When you have the data file selected, press the button Open or the Enter key. The sonoUno will generate the graph (Image 10) and update the abscissa‚Äôs slide bar. Everything is ready, pressing the ‚ÄúPlay‚Äù button should start the reproduction.

trans-unit.source: You can open a wav file and get the dataset from its envelope. You can access the functionality under the Input dropdown Menu, and just like in the CSV file, the system file browser will pop up and you'll be able to select the file and load it.
trans-unit.target: You can open a wav file and get the dataset from its envelope. You can access the functionality under the Input dropdown Menu, and just like in the CSV file, the system file browser will pop up and you'll be able to select the file and load it.

trans-unit.source: A .wav file has a sampling rate, defined by the amount of values recorded in a second, by now we are calculating the envelope values by the square root of the average of a set amount of values. In the near future we will be adding the possibility of modifying the gate of values for that average, until then it's set to 5.
trans-unit.target: A .wav file has a sampling rate, defined by the amount of values recorded in a second, by now we are calculating the envelope values by the square root of the average of a set amount of values. In the near future we will be adding the possibility of modifying the gate of values for that average, until then it's set to 5.

trans-unit.source: After uploading the wav file, the envelope of the file will be loaded to the graph as a . Everything is ready, pressing the ‚ÄúPlay‚Äù button should start the reproduction.
trans-unit.target: After uploading the wav file, the envelope of the file will be loaded to the graph as a . Everything is ready, pressing the ‚ÄúPlay‚Äù button should start the reproduction.

trans-unit.source: You can easily export the list of markers that you add to your given data set via the export markers option, now we will talk about how you can easily import that saved data to apply it again to the data set. You can access the functionality under the Input dropdown Menu, and after clicking in the Markers CSV option you can import the file that you have saved. As it's the web version of SonoUno it will most likely be on your Downloads folder.
trans-unit.target: You can easily export the list of markers that you add to your given data set via the export markers option, now we will talk about how you can easily import that saved data to apply it again to the data set. You can access the functionality under the Input dropdown Menu, and after clicking in the Markers CSV option you can import the file that you have saved. As it's the web version of SonoUno it will most likely be on your Downloads folder.

trans-unit.source: After loading the markers the graph should be updated with the list of markers that you have uploaded, in this case we have only three but you can save and later import as many as you want. It's important to insist that this functionality should be used with the data set where the markers taken, the points of the graph are saved in absolute numbers and not relative to their positions on the plot, loading the markers on another data set with a different range or functions could result in errors and most certainly in failures and unexpected behaviors.
trans-unit.target: After loading the markers the graph should be updated with the list of markers that you have uploaded, in this case we have only three but you can save and later import as many as you want. It's important to insist that this functionality should be used with the data set where the markers taken, the points of the graph are saved in absolute numbers and not relative to their positions on the plot, loading the markers on another data set with a different range or functions could result in errors and most certainly in failures and unexpected behaviors.

trans-unit.source: 3.4. Mark and Delete all marks button
trans-unit.target: 3.4. Mark and Delete all marks button

trans-unit.source: Before starting with this functionality, we must explain that the sonoUno allows the user to mark points of interest on the data, and store the coordinates on a vector or file. These marks are shown with a diverse amount of user selectable symbols over the plot (Image 11).
trans-unit.target: Before starting with this functionality, we must explain that the sonoUno allows the user to mark points of interest on the data, and store the coordinates on a vector or file. These marks are shown with a diverse amount of user selectable symbols over the plot (Image 11).

trans-unit.source: The functionality of the ‚ÄúDelete Mark‚Äù button placed under the graph (Image11), is to erase the last added mark point on the data.
trans-unit.target: The functionality of the ‚ÄúDelete Mark‚Äù button placed under the graph (Image11), is to erase the last added mark point on the data.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to save files
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to save files

trans-unit.source: In the dropdown menu, the option ‚ÄúOutput‚Äù deploys the list of options to save: Sound, Marked Points, Plot (from top to bottom) (Image 12). Image 12 Displays the sonoUno interface with an opened data file. At the top Menu, the Output button displays the Save Sound, Save Markers , Save Plot possibilities.
trans-unit.target: In the dropdown menu, the option ‚ÄúOutput‚Äù deploys the list of options to save: Sound, Marked Points, Plot (from top to bottom) (Image 12). Image 12 Displays the sonoUno interface with an opened data file. At the top Menu, the Output button displays the Save Sound, Save Markers , Save Plot possibilities.

trans-unit.source: REsearch INfrastructures FOR Citizens in Europe
trans-unit.target: REsearch INfrastructures FOR Citizens in Europe

trans-unit.source: SonoUno is a sonification software for astronomical data presented on a table, allowing the user to configure the generated plot and some features of the sound.
trans-unit.target: SonoUno is a sonification software for astronomical data presented on a table, allowing the user to configure the generated plot and some features of the sound.

trans-unit.source: Do not show this landing page again.
trans-unit.target: Do not show this landing page again.

trans-unit.source: SonoUno counts with a default sound configuration, allowing you to load data and start playing the sonified data, if you want, you can always start twinkling around with the different values found in ‚ÄòSound configuration‚Äô, allowing you to change the volume, minimum and maximum frequencies or the envelope filter settings.
trans-unit.target: SonoUno counts with a default sound configuration, allowing you to load data and start playing the sonified data, if you want, you can always start twinkling around with the different values found in ‚ÄòSound configuration‚Äô, allowing you to change the volume, minimum and maximum frequencies or the envelope filter settings.

trans-unit.source: To help you get started as fast as possible exploring sonoUno‚Äôs capabilities, sonoUno has a set of ‚ÄúSample Data‚Äù under the ‚ÄòFile‚Äô dropdown menu. This will allow you to see how the data is processed and how the resulting screen looks like at the event of a successful data load.
trans-unit.target: To help you get started as fast as possible exploring sonoUno‚Äôs capabilities, sonoUno has a set of ‚ÄúSample Data‚Äù under the ‚ÄòFile‚Äô dropdown menu. This will allow you to see how the data is processed and how the resulting screen looks like at the event of a successful data load.

trans-unit.source: When the page starts you should only see a blank plot and at the instant you load data it will be displayed at it. You can zoom in by clicking and dragging at a section of the graph or using the menu at the top-right corner of the plot. If you want to modify the color or the stroke of the lines, the color or shape of the markers or the tags on the plot you can do it in the ‚ÄòPlot configuration‚Äô on the bottom right side of the page.
trans-unit.target: When the page starts you should only see a blank plot and at the instant you load data it will be displayed at it. You can zoom in by clicking and dragging at a section of the graph or using the menu at the top-right corner of the plot. If you want to modify the color or the stroke of the lines, the color or shape of the markers or the tags on the plot you can do it in the ‚ÄòPlot configuration‚Äô on the bottom right side of the page.

trans-unit.source: You can add your ‚Äò.csv‚Äô (Comma Separated File) via the ‚ÄòBrowse‚Ä¶‚Äô option on the ‚ÄòFile‚Äô dropdown menu. The file can have one or two columns, the first being the Abscissa axis and the second the ordinate, in the case you only provide one column with data, each value would be assigned to the ordinate and an incremental value would be assigned to the abscissa value.
trans-unit.target: You can add your ‚Äò.csv‚Äô (Comma Separated File) via the ‚ÄòBrowse‚Ä¶‚Äô option on the ‚ÄòFile‚Äô dropdown menu. The file can have one or two columns, the first being the Abscissa axis and the second the ordinate, in the case you only provide one column with data, each value would be assigned to the ordinate and an incremental value would be assigned to the abscissa value.

trans-unit.source: Behind the plot you have four buttons, two very self explanatory to play and pause the reproduction of the sound, the ‚ÄòMark point‚Äô allows you to add markers at the point of reproduction of the data, this will be added to an array that you can download at the ‚ÄòFile‚Äô menu and the ‚ÄòRemove mark‚Äô button that allows you to pop the last added mark point.
trans-unit.target: Behind the plot you have four buttons, two very self explanatory to play and pause the reproduction of the sound, the ‚ÄòMark point‚Äô allows you to add markers at the point of reproduction of the data, this will be added to an array that you can download at the ‚ÄòFile‚Äô menu and the ‚ÄòRemove mark‚Äô button that allows you to pop the last added mark point.
